dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1808 IH: Tax Cuts for America Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Castro of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions for 1 year.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Tax Cuts for America Act of 2015.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Title I—Economic development and job creation
Sec. 101. Extension of new markets tax credit.
Sec. 102. Extension of work opportunity tax credit.
Sec. 103. Extension and modification of research credit.
Sec. 201. Extension of deduction for certain expenses of elementary and secondary school teachers.
Title III—Members of the Armed Forces
Sec. 301. Extension of employer wage credit for employees who are active duty members of the uniformed services.
Sec. 401. Extension of credit for construction of new energy efficient homes.
Sec. 101. Extension of State and local sales tax deduction.

section.header: Extension of new markets tax credit

subsection.text: Section 45D(f)(1)(G) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking and 2014 and inserting 2014, and 2015.
Section 45D(f)(3) of such Code is amended by striking 2019 and inserting 2020.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to calendar years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Extension of work opportunity tax credit

subsection.text: Section 51(c)(4)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015..
The amendment made by this section shall apply to individuals who begin work for the employer after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Extension and modification of research credit

subsection.text: Section 41(h)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to amounts paid or incurred after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Extension of deduction for certain expenses of elementary and secondary school teachers

subsection.text: Section 62(a)(2)(D) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking or 2014 and inserting 2014, or 2015.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Extension of employer wage credit for employees who are active duty members of the uniformed services

subsection.text: Section 45P(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to payments made after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Extension of credit for construction of new energy efficient homes

subsection.text: Section 45P(g) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to acquisitions after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Extension of State and local sales tax deduction

subsection.text: Section 164(b)(5)(I) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking January 1, 2015 and inserting January 1, 2016.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
